intro: Verbascum glochotrichum, commonly known as the Kashmir woolly mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
